title.narrative: 4.5 FS-CAP.DEV'T OF COORD. STRUCTURE

description.narrative: 104/005 By 2020, existing sub-national coordinating structures have increased capacity to plan, monitor, implement and evaluate interventions that address children's issues, particularly in urban, rural and Chittagong Hill Tracts districts, ensuring the mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction. Field Services, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, an enhanced policy environment and national and sub-national systems are in place for the realization of child rights, with a focus on equity, guided by knowledge and evidence.

title.narrative: 104/005 By 2020, existing sub-national coordinating structures have increased capacity to plan, monitor, implement and evaluateinterventions that address children?s issues, particularly in urban, rural and Chittagong Hill Tracts districts, ensuring themainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction. Field Services

description.narrative: Government-led‘Thematic Group on Children’ sub-national coordination platform continuedfollowing up onchildren’sissuesand priorities.Atraining plan for360 officialson‘Evidence-based planning;and;budgeting for childrenwas developed and ready for field implementation.Disaster Management Committees;in;22;districts improved their capacity and made plans sensitive to the needs of children and women.Bangladesh Scoutsprovided;life skillsand online safetytrainingto;760 youth leaders (50;per centgirls).Inthe Chittagong HillTracts,300newpara centreswereconstructedforaround 15,000 familieswhowillhave access to;basic services like primary education, health, etc. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
